graphglobalalignment

Interface IGraphGlobalAlignment

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GraphGlobalAlignment

    public interface IGraphGlobalAlignment
    The package is an interface to compare two graphs globally. The assumptions of input graphs are,
    • every node is distinct;
    • and, no multiple edges between any pair of nodes.
    • Simple Graphs are preferred.

    The graph comparison is categorized into three kinds,

    • either Outer (Union based, including all nodes of two graphs),
    • or Inner (Intersection based, only including the same nodes shared by two graphs),
    • or Left (Biased, only considering one graph).

    In order to considering the case of possible missing edges, some degrees of transitivity are allowed when comparing two graphs.

    Note, the input usually includes two graphs in adjacency matrix format and related nodes array. The nodes array is an array of string (containing the primary key of each node) with the same order with the adjacent matrices. The penalty system is optional.

    • Method Detail

      • GraphAlignmentJoin_INNER

        double GraphAlignmentJoin_INNER(java.lang.String[] pri_list1,
                              int[][] matrix1,
                              java.lang.String[] pri_list2,
                              int[][] matrix2)
        Calculate the global similarity only considering the overlap nodes of two graphs.

        Default penalty system: match score = +1; mismatch score = -1;

        Parameters:
        pri_list1 - the nodes array of the first graph
        matrix1 - the adjacent matrix of the first graph
        pri_list2 - the nodes array of the second graph
        matrix2 - the nodes array of the second graph
        Returns:
        similarity

      • GraphAlignmentJoin_INNER

        double GraphAlignmentJoin_INNER(java.lang.String[] pri_list1,
                              int[][] matrix1,
                              java.lang.String[] pri_list2,
                              int[][] matrix2,
                              double mismatch,
                              double match)
        Calculate the global similarity, only considering the overlap nodes of two graphs and with customized penalty system.

        User input penalty system.

        Parameters:
        pri_list1 - the nodes array of the first graph
        matrix1 - the adjacent matrix of the first graph
        pri_list2 - the nodes array of the second graph
        matrix2 - the nodes array of the second graph
        mismatch - the mismatch score of penalty system
        match - the match score of penalty system
        Returns:
        similarity

        matrix1 - the adjacent matrix of the first graph
        pri_list2 - the nodes array of the second graph
        matrix2 - the nodes array of the second graph
        k - the transitivity degree
        Returns:
        similarity
